content: I think that BFS/DFS based clashes in general are too difficult for most players to do in 5 minutes. There have been similar clashes before that require exploration of a 2D grid, but they usually have some constraint to either only allow one path or skip the DFS/BFS altogether.

General
* Please study the formatting syntax described in this link ( https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement ), and apply formatting as described in the points below.

Goal
* Please format "H" and "W" as [[variables]].

* Please format ".", "#" and "-1" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks around the characters of "." and "#".

Input
* Please format "Line 1" in <<bold>>.

* Please format "H" and "W" as [[variables]].

* Please change "Next H lines" to "<<Next [[H]] lines>>".

* Please format "." and "#" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please mention it is a line of the grid in the second description.

Output
* Please format "One line" in <<bold>>.

* Please format "H" and "W" as [[variables]].

* Please format "-1" as a {{constant}}.

Constraints
* Please format "H" and "W" as [[variables]].

* Please change 40 to 10.

Stub generator
* Please change 50 to W.

Cases
* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs and outputs (except when the expected output is -1). Please update these cases accordingly:

  â€¢ Single obstacle (3Ã—3) test - please place a # at (0, 0) and another at (2, 2).

  â€¢Â Narrow passage (3Ã—6) test and Side corridor (4Ã—5) validator - please modify one of these cases so that their expected outputs are different.

* Please add a pair of cases where no path exists because the path is blocked somewhere other than the start or end cells.

* Please add a pair of cases where [[H]] > [[W]].

Thanks.
Thanks for your returns, just updated the COC contribution.

Thanks for the input. Iâ€™ve thought about it, but Iâ€™m not changing the core mechanic. The clash is designed as a classic grid shortest-path problem, and Iâ€™ve already incorporated 5DN1Lâ€™s requested changes (formatting, constraints, test cases). Difficulty can vary by player level, and the time limit is a guideline. Iâ€™ll leave the submission as is.
Honestly, I don't think BFS/DFS should be required for a clash, but I'll let other reviewers decide whether they want to approve or reject this clash.

Understood, and thanks for leaving it to the other reviewers. For context: the grid size is capped ([[H]] and [[W]] â‰¤ 10 per the constraints), so a simple BFS stays short and is in line with other grid path clashes. I'm happy for it to be approved or rejected based on the team's view of difficulty.
Thank you for your understanding. ðŸ™‚
It seems that you haven't followed up all the points or the contribution hasn't been saved properly?

Yes, I can see the changes now. Here are some points to follow up:

Goal
* Please do not duplicate the Input, Output and Constraints sections here. Only the first paragraph should remain; the rest should be removed.

Input
* Please split the two descriptions into separate lines.

Output
* Please apply bold formatting to "A single integer" correctly.

Cases
* Please add a pair of cases where # actually affects the result and the expected output is neither -1 nor H + W - 2.

Thanks.
Modifications applied, sorry, i forgot to reply to u
No worries. I don't have further comments for now. Thank you.
